Best Passive Welding Helmets – Top Picks & Reviews

June 9, 2021April 28, 2021 by Brayden
1.6k
SHARES
ShareTweet

Passive welding helmets are quite comfortable and easy to handle with all instructions. These helmets contain protective lenses coated with UV rays and IR radiations that protect you and your eyes from these harmful rays. Choosing a good welding helmet shows your concern about your safety and your duty as well.

They contain fixed shades, which help eliminate many imperfections and color saturations to provide the most accurate view of the base material. These are light weighted and more portable to handle to minimize your fatigue after working a whole day.

So, select the best passive welding helmets according to your requirement as they are necessary while welding.

List of Top 7 Best Passive Welding Helmets
1. Jackson HLX 10
2. Jackson 14535 Huntsman
3. Miller MP10 Passive Welder’s Helmet
4. Fibre-Metal Pipeliner Welding Helmet
5. Jackson Safety 14975
6. Fiber-Metal (906Gy)
Sellstrom-28301 Passive Helmet

Best Overall

1. Jackson HLX 10

Specifications:

  • Type: HLX 100 Style
  • Viewing Area: 4.5″ x 5.25″
  • Filter Shade: Shade 10
  • Shell: Hydraflex
  • Product Dimensions: 8.65 x 10.9 x 15.5 inches
  • Item Weight: 0.010 ounces
Check Price On Amazon

Overview:

Jackson HLX 10 is the best passive welding helmet to use as it is highly comfortable and lightweight to use. It is ADF adaptable and contains a fixed front of 4.5 In. X 5.25 In. with ten different shade lenses. It is hard adaptable. This lightweight shell help to reduce the tension with the complete package of 10 shade polycarbonate windows and a cover plate.

Jackson HLX 10 hydra flex shell provides the ultimate flexibility and durability. It is comfortable as you can wear it for several hours and auto-darkening in functions. It contains awesome headgear. All the professionals in all life work demanded this helmet to provide innovative safety solutions, enduring values, and comfort.

I want to refer Jackson HLX 10 passive lens welding helmet to all professionals and beginners. It contains a factor of light weightiness, which helps to minimize your whole day’s fatigue.

Strength
  • Lightweight, you can easily wear it for long hours
  • Best for Mig/TiG Welding
  • Gold-coated glass works great
  • Very solid welding hood
  • Won’t face any snap or crack issue because of plastic flexibility
  • Perfect for learning at home
Weakness
  • Difficult to reconfigure it
  • Not Suitable for the Power User
  • Expensive

Jackson 14535 Huntsman is the best passive welding hood as it contains not no frills. This fixed shade helmet contains ten different shades and best for the occasional use. It worth the money as it will cost you more in a weld shop.

All the professional workers prefer this model as it is highly durable and contains easy adjustments. The best part is, users can also upgrade this passive helmet into auto-darkening filters.

3. Miller MP10 Passive Welder’s Helmet

Specifications:

  • Lens Shade: 8 to 12
  • Plate height: 3-2/5″
  • plate width: 4″
  • Viewing Area: 15-7/10 square inches
  • Headgear: Ratchet
  • Item Weight: 1.75 pounds 
Check Price On Amazon

Overview:

Miller MP10 passive Welder’s Helmet comes in black color. It is so classic MP-10 and contains 8 to 12 lens shades. This fixed shade welding helmet is constructed with nylon and includes magnifying lens holders, 5 outside and 2 inside cover lenses. And the plate height is 3-2/5,” and the plate width is 4”. It contains an excellent viewing area of 15-7/10 square inches.

Miller MP10 passive Welder’s Helmet is a non-darkening welding helmet and can work at low amperage TIG. It contains a solid, comfortable, and durable hood.

This helmet is a perfect passive helmet for all the beginners with the best bang buck, so I recommend this as you can use it easily by reading instructions.

4. Fibre-Metal Pipeliner Welding Helmet

Check Price On Amazon

Overview:

Fiber-Metal Pipeliner Fiberglass Welding Helmet is a unique and best passive welding helmet with customized ratchet headgear (110WH). It contains a rugged superglass material that is challenging but lightweight to use.

This impervious moisture and impact resistant prevents cracks and chips. It contains a 2” x 4” shade lens for the clear viewing of the weld puddle; this filters 100 percent UV rays and IR radiations and different wavelengths for maximum eye protection.

I recommend this fiberglass fixed lens welding helmet for its attractive & protective design; its compact design allows the users to access the enclosed and tight clearance areas where there is no room for the standard helmets.

Its universal size is 14975, and it is highly portable & durable to use. This helmet provides an economical way for the students, welding hobbyists, professional workers, and inspectors to practice welding safely.

Jackson Safety 14975 offers a large field of vision for the clear view of all the weld puddle that is helpful in MIG welding, TIG welding, and Arc welding. It contains a welding mask with an extended front that increases the throat protection from slag fumes, sparks, and other physical hazards.

I like Jackson Safety 14975 passive helmet as it provides a safer environment and more efficient welding environment. It is available at a reasonable price.

Overview:

Sellstorm-28301 Lightweight is a bucket-styled passive welding hood with attractive ratchet headgear, 2” x 4.25” lift front that includes the filters and cover plates. It is made up of super tuff nylon and attractive in black color. Sellstorm Manufacturing Co. is included in the oldest American brands of safety products, and it was founded in 1953.

This passive welding helmet’s lightweight design comes assembled with the ratchet headgear and a forehead band that can be fit.

The 2”x 4 ¼” lift front provides spring-loaded positive lock features. This helmet is best for all welding applications. It is also designed for pipeline welders and provides head protection and chin guards.

I recommend this helmet because Sellstorm-28301 has received many well-coming reviews as many people are using this excellent helmet for decades.

FAQ’s

Passive welding helmets are fitted with the fixed shade lenses, standard glass viewing lens coated with UV rays, and IR radiation protection. They are usually much cheaper than many other auto-darkening counterparts. Welding while using these helmets involves nodding helmets up and down to inspect the weld puddle and reposition the torch between welds.

  • Jackson W10 HSL 100
  • Miller MP-10

These both are lightweights and have excellent optical quality. Welders use them professionally and get a lot of benefits.

The best passive welding helmet provides good head & face welding protection. It should have a large viewing lens that is a piece of dark-tinted glass that is usually with ten shades, and they are also coated with the UV rays and IR radiations. It should be comfortable and easy to use. And should be available in the low price range.

Passive welding helmets contain a standard glass viewing of lens fitting. It is usually in the shade 10, and these helmets also have UV rays and IR radiation protection. While using passive welding helmets, you have to nod the helmet up and down a couple of times. These lenses contain a large viewing area.

Passive welding helmets are quite comfortable and durable to use. You can start passive welding while using these passive welding helmets, but you have to nod the helmets up and down a couple of times. It’s for you to inspect many and different welding puddles that facilitate the repositioning of the torch between welds.

Conclusion

Best passive welding helmets are usable for the students and professionals as they are so comfortable and unique in their style. You can easily use them. They protect you from harmful UV rays and IR radiation.

These helmets with modern lens technology, innovative headgear with the fixed shade of lenses, and a low-profile external grind button increase productivity. These welding helmets are quite best to use and handle. These properties improve the helmet’s balance, helps to eliminate pressure points. Passive welding helmets also provide a personalized fit for maximum comfort.

After deep research on all passive helmets, I conclude that the following are the top 3 passive welding helmets that you can consider.

  1. Jackson HLX 10
  2. Jackson 14535 Huntsman
  3. Miller MP10 passive Welder’s Helmet
